selected_quotes: if you worry about climate change, you should stop eating meat and other animal products

Carbon footprint of US-consumed foods, Fish Vs Meats #CarbonFootprint #LCA #Waste

citation.title: Greenhouse Gas Emission Estimates of U.S. Dietary Choices and Food Loss

news.title: Dietary Guidelines Are Not So Sustainable, Study Says
news.summary: Researchers say our eating and environmental goals don't align

news.title: Dietary recommendations may be tied to increased greenhouse gas emissions
news.summary: If Americans altered their menus to conform to federal dietary recommendations, emissions of heat-trapping greenhouse gases tied to agricultural production could increase significantly, according to a new study.

news.title: Following USDA Dietary Guidelines Could Increase Greenhouse Gas Emissions
news.summary: Chuck Bednar for redOrbit.com - Your Universe Online If Americans followed dietary guidelines passed by the USDA in 2010 while maintaining their current caloric intake, it would increase food-related greenhouse gas emissions by 12 percent, researchers clai

news.title: Quartz Daily Brief—Europe edition—Apple’s big reveal, insider trader jailed, green junk food, space tweets
news.summary: What to watch for today The US moves forward against the Islamic State. Secretary of state John Kerry will travel to the Middle East to meet with regional leaders, while US officials say they are close to identifying the British-accented man who executed j

news.title: Dietary Recommendations can Increase Greenhouse Gases
news.summary: A new study reported that if everyone followed the USDA's dietary recommendations, greenhouse gas emissions would increase.

news.title: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Could Increase By 12% If Pubic Adopts USDA's Dietary Guidelines
news.summary: The U.S. Department of Agriculture should consider changing its dietary guidelines to reduce animal products in order to decrease dietary greenhouse gas emissions, says a study.

news.title: An American Plate That Is Palatable for Human and Planetary Health
news.summary: What we eat determines our health. It also decides the health of our planet. In the newly proposed Dietary Guidelines , the US is finally moving towards acknowledging the fundamental connections between human and planetary health. The improved diets sugges

news.title: Eat More Plants to Improve Health, Combat Climate Change
news.summary: U.K. researchers find changed diets could substantially cut greenhouse gas pollution and benefit health -- Read more on ScientificAmerican.com

news.title: Quartz Daily Brief—Americas edition—Apple’s big reveal, MH17 crash report, Google vs EU, London’s billboard cake
news.summary: Good morning, Quartz readers! What to watch for today Apple’s big reveal. At today’s event in California, expect Apple to unveil new larger-screened iPhones, some sort of wearable device, and a new mobile-payments system that some say could kill credit car

news.title: Lettuce Produces More Greenhouse Gas Emissions Per Calorie Than Bacon Does
news.summary: Bacon lovers of the world, rejoice! Or at the least take solace that your beloved pork belly may be better for the environment in terms of greenhouse gas emissions than the lettuce that accompanies it on the classic BLT.

news.title: Americans’ love of junk food is surprisingly good for the environment
news.summary: It’s hardly surprising that the country that pioneered the McGangBang is facing an obesity epidemic. But the fondness for fat and sugar that’s making more and more Americans sick has a strange upside: It creates fewer greenhouse gases (GHG) than a healthy

news.title: Dietary effect on GHG emissions is hard to swallow
news.summary: Controversial new research findings say that US government guidelines on a better diet might be good for Americans’ health, but would be far from healthy for the climate.
